SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To measure the telomere length in patients with bone marrow failure syndrome (BMF) using fluorescence in situ hybridization and flow cytometry (Flow-FISH)
METHODS: Blood samples were collected from 8 patients with BMF

Telomere lengths of mononuclear cells from 8 BMF patients and granulocytes from 3 of these 8 BMF patients (all these 3 patients were suffered from aplastic anemia) were measured using Flow-FISH, and the results were compared with those of normal controls
Telomere lengths were measured by Southern blot in 3 patients, and the results were compared with those obtained from Flow-FISH
RESULTS: Among these 8 BMF patients, 5 have decreased telomere length in their mononuclear cells
However, different white cell subgroups, specifically mononucleated cells and granulocytes, have different degree of telomere shortening
In 3 BMF patients who underwent both Flow-FISH and Southern blot, 2 patients had consistent measurement results
CONCLUSION: Flow-FISH can be used for the measurement of telomere length in Chinese patients with BMF
